lines.text: Do you mean to say you *don't* promise never to touch a motorcar again?
On the contrary! I *faithfully* promise that the first motor car I see...
[puts on his driving goggles]
Poop-poop!
[repeated line]
Oh, I say!
Reggie!

[flags down Reggie, the motorist]
I say, I wonder if you could help me. Having a spot of bother with me car.
Oh? Wh-wh-what sort of bother?
Um... em... it's the... uh... crankshaft... it's um... flat.
Really? Ah ha... I should be able to fix that.
Oh, shall I come too Reggie?
[gets out of the car]
Uh. Wh-wh-wh-where's your machine?

[gestures to a spot behind him]
Oh... it's over there. If you'd just take a look at it?
Oh c-certainly old bean. Anything for a fellow motorist.
[as soon as they move away from their car, Mr. Toad gets in, puts it in gear and drives away]
Oh, I say!
[they see Mr. Toad driving down the road erratically, laughing, honking the horn]
Oh. Reggie.

[to Mr. Toad]
I've been told you are a criminal of deepest guilt, and matchless artfulness and resource... whatever that means.
[chasing Mr. Toad in a train]
[shouting]
I say old bean, where's my car?
Oh Reggie.

[after crashing his second car]
You know, I really am worried about Toad.
Oh, don't you worry. It's just another one of his passions. He'll grow out of it.

[off in the distance]
Poop-poop!
I hope.

[having just overflown his friends in his new airplane]
Ha ha! Hello you fellows!
You maniac!
LOCK HIM UP!
Toad! This time you've gone too far!
Hang motoring! This is the life!

[giving his statement to the Police Office about his stolen car]
A fellow there flagged me down, cobbled a story about a "flat crankshaft." Well, so I help a fellow motorist, go out, galloped away! Th-the chap's a damn frog!

[hears noises. All three turn to see Toad in Reggie's car, still honking the horn and making car noises]
Poop-poop!
I say!

[Toad roars past, knocking the police officer and his bicycle over, and Reggie into the arms of his wife]
Wha-wha-hey hey-hey!
[to the officer]
Fat face!

[after seeing Mr. Toad, dressed as a Washerwoman, escape from the police on a train]
Say, Rosemary, isn't that the frog who stole my car?
